1439624191226036230.text: Wildland Fire Mitigation & Management Commission Act: The Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act includes this bipartisan bill, which establishes a commission to study and recommend wildland fire prevention, mitigation, suppression, management, and rehabilitation policies.

1439624189993005061.text: Watershed Protection: The legislation provides hundreds of millions of dollars for the Emergency Watershed Protection Program to help local communities recover after wildfires.

1439624188248084482.text: Mitigating and Recovering from Wildfires: The Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act allows the use of Emergency Relief program funding for protective features to mitigate the risk of recurring damage or the cost of future repairs from natural disasters.

1439624186624974856.text: Forecasting and Detecting Drought: Our plan funds the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration’s high-performance computing -- allowing the agency to improve drought, flood, and wildfire prediction and detection.

1439624185194688521.text: Fireweather Test Bed Programs: The Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act invests $100 million to improve wildfire prediction, detection, observation, modeling, and forecasting.

1439624184066359297.text: Road and Trail Restoration: Our historic proposal provides funding to remediate Forest Service legacy roads and trails.

1439624180987830272.text: Burned Area Rehabilitation: The Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act provides $450 million for the Forest Service and the Department of Interior to carry out Burned Area Rehabilitation.

1439624175153516548.text: Community Defense Grants: The Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act invests $500 million for Forest Service Community Defense Grants.

1439624172976607233.text: REPLANT Act: Our plan includes this legislation, which helps the U.S. Forest Service plant 1.2 billion trees on national forest lands, creating nearly 49,000 jobs over the next decade.

1439624168107085830.text: Hazardous Fuels: The Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act provides $2.4 billion for the Forest Service and the Department of Interior to reduce hazardous fuels on federal, state, and Tribal lands.

1439624163954774023.text: Wildfires increasingly threaten the health and safety of AZ communities. Our bipartisan Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act makes historic investments to prevent and mitigate the impacts of wildfires and boost communities’ recoveries from such disasters.🧵

1439299473646276613.text: Tribal Climate Resilience: The plan provides $216 million for Tribal climate resilience, adaptation, and community planning, design, and implementation of projects that address climate challenges.

1439299472585023491.text: Raising the Voices of Native American Communities: The Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act establishes a new Assistant Secretary for Tribal Government Affairs under the U.S. Department of Transportation.

1439299471398031365.text: Tribal Cybersecurity Grants: The Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act establishes a new federal cybersecurity grant program for Tribal Governments.

1439299470299127809.text: Bureau of Indian Affairs Road Maintenance Program: The historic legislation significantly boosts funding for the Road Maintenance Program.

1439299469120622598.text: Tribal Public Transportation Modernization: Our bill provides over $20 million for Arizona Tribal governments to improve and modernize their public transportation systems.

1439299467916845058.text: Tribal Broadband: The Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act sets aside $2 billion for the Tribal Broadband Connectivity Program, boosting broadband deployment, digital inclusion, workforce development, telehealth, and distance learning.

1439299466738155525.text: Indian Water Rights Settlements: The legislation provides full funding to complete all currently-authorized Indian Water Rights Settlements.

1439299465500823552.text: Critical Tribal Water Infrastructure: The Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act invests $3.5 billion in the Indian Health Service Sanitation Facilities Construction program for water infrastructure and resiliency.

1439299464393592845.text: Tribal Governments and Native American Communities will directly benefit from our bill which expands economic opportunities while respecting tribal sovereignty. Here’s how.👇
